summary: Parent workflow with POLICY_ABANDON child close policy incorrectly waits for child workflow completion instead of abandoning it. Using yield causes parent to block, while omitting yield prevents parent from starting.
userImpact: Users cannot properly implement fire-and-forget child workflows with abandon policy, breaking async patterns for background tasks.
rootCause: Parent workflow incorrectly waits for child completion despite POLICY_ABANDON setting, suggesting policy is not properly applied during child workflow execution.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved in PHP SDK by properly implementing POLICY_ABANDON semantics so parent workflows don't wait for child completion.
keyQuote: Having yield in the parent - it always waits for child to be completed. Without yield the parent event doesn't start.
